info.title: SonarQube Web API v2
info.description:
The SonarQube API v2 is a REST API which enables you to interact with SonarQube programmatically.
While not all endpoints of the former Web API are available yet, the ones available are stable and can be used in production environments.

get.description:
Get a list of users. By default, only active users are returned.
  The following fields are only returned when user has Administer System permission or for logged-in in user :
    'email',
    'externalIdentity',
    'externalProvider',
    'groups',
    'lastConnectionDate',
    'sonarLintLastConnectionDate',
    'tokensCount'.
  Field 'sonarqubeLastConnectionDate' is only updated every hour, so it may not be accurate, for instance when a user authenticates many times in less than one hour.
  The results are sorted alphabetically by login.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Return active/inactive users

schema.description: Return active/inactive users

parameters.name: managed
parameters.description: Return managed or non-managed users. Only available for managed instances, throws for non-managed instances

schema.description: Return managed or non-managed users. Only available for managed instances, throws for non-managed instances

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Filter on login, name and email.
This parameter performs a partial match (contains), it is case insensitive.

schema.description:
Filter on login, name and email.
This parameter performs a partial match (contains), it is case insensitive.

parameters.name: externalIdentity
parameters.description:
Filter on externalIdentity.
This parameter perform a case-sensitive exact match

schema.description:
Filter on externalIdentity.
This parameter perform a case-sensitive exact match

parameters.name: sonarQubeLastConnectionDateFrom
parameters.description: Filter users based on the last connection date field. Only users who interacted with this instance at or after the date will be returned. The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hhmm)

schema.description: Filter users based on the last connection date field. Only users who interacted with this instance at or after the date will be returned. The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hhmm)

parameters.name: sonarQubeLastConnectionDateTo
parameters.description: Filter users based on the last connection date field. Only users that never connected or who interacted with this instance at or before the date will be returned. The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hhmm)

schema.description: Filter users based on the last connection date field. Only users that never connected or who interacted with this instance at or before the date will be returned. The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hhmm)

parameters.name: sonarLintLastConnectionDateFrom
parameters.description: Filter users based on the SonarLint last connection date field Only users who interacted with this instance using SonarLint at or after the date will be returned. The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hhmm)

schema.description: Filter users based on the SonarLint last connection date field Only users who interacted with this instance using SonarLint at or after the date will be returned. The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hhmm)

parameters.name: sonarLintLastConnectionDateTo
parameters.description: Filter users based on the SonarLint last connection date field. Only users that never connected or who interacted with this instance using SonarLint at or before the date will be returned. The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hhmm)

schema.description: Filter users based on the SonarLint last connection date field. Only users that never connected or who interacted with this instance using SonarLint at or before the date will be returned. The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hhmm)

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Filter users belonging to group. Only available for system administrators. Using != operator will exclude users from this group.

schema.description: Filter users belonging to group. Only available for system administrators. Using != operator will exclude users from this group.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per page. A value of 0 will only return the pagination information.

schema.description: Number of results per page. A value of 0 will only return the pagination information.

parameters.name: pageIndex
parameters.description: 1-based page index

schema.description: 1-based page index

post.description:
Create a user.
  If a deactivated user account exists with the given login, it will be reactivated.
  Requires Administer System permission.

get.description:
Get the list of email configurations.
  Note that a single configuration is supported at this time.
  Requires 'Administer System' permission.

post.description:
Create a new email configuration.
  Note that only a single configuration can exist at a time.
  Requires 'Administer System' permission.

get.description: List the license profiles that have been configured for use when evaluating license issues.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: If provided, filter to the license profile that is used to analyze the project (if one exists).

schema.description: If provided, filter to the license profile that is used to analyze the project (if one exists).

post.description: Create a new license profile for projects to use when evaluating license issues.

post.summary: Update the assignee of an (issue,release) pair
post.description:
Update the assignee of an (issue,release) pair (dependency risk).

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

post.summary: Manually change the severity of an issue-release pair
post.description:
Change the severity of a (issue,release) pair (dependency risk).

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

post.summary: Dismiss the increased severity warning for an issue-release pair after reviewing the warning
post.description:
Dismiss the increased severity warning for an (issue,release) pair (dependency risk) after reviewing the warning.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

post.summary: Transition an issue-release pair to a new status
post.description:
Transition a single (issue,release) pair (dependency risk) to a new status with a comment about why the status is changing.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

post.summary: Add a comment to an issue-release pair
post.description:
Add a comment to a (issue,release) pair (dependency risk).

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

post.summary: Bills user's Azure account with the cost of SonarQube Server license
post.description: Used by admin to bill user's Azure account with the cost of SonarQube Server license.

get.description:
Fetch the Jira work items for a specific Sonar project and resource.
Accepts only authenticated requests.

post.description:
Create a Jira work item for a specific resource.
Accepts only authenticated requests with issue administration permission.

delete.description: Delete the Jira work items associated with a specific resource.

get.description:
Fetch the Jira project binding for a specific Sonar project.
Accepts only authenticated requests.

post.summary: Create or update Jira project binding
post.description:
Create or update a Jira project binding for a specific Sonar project.
Accepts only authenticated requests.

delete.description:
Delete the Jira project binding for a specific Sonar project.
Accepts only authenticated requests.

patch.description:
Update an existing Jira project binding for a specific Sonar project.
Accepts only authenticated requests.

get.description:
Fetch the Jira instance binding.
Requires global administrator permission.

post.summary: Create a new Jira instance binding
post.description:
Receives the 3LO state and authorization code parameters and attempts to create an instance binding.
If successful, returns the binding. Otherwise, returns a list of available resources.
Requires global administrator permission.

delete.description:
Deletes the Jira instance binding from the database.
Requires global administrator permission.

patch.summary: Binds the specified pending instance binding with the specified jira cloud ID
patch.description: Binds the specified pending instance binding with the specified jira cloud ID

post.description:
Creates a new user binding between a SonarQube user and their Slack account.
This endpoint is used during the Slack OAuth flow when users connect their accounts
via the /sonarqube-server connect slash command.

Handles incoming Slack slash command requests and command processing.
The request body is form-encoded and contains command details. Signature validation is performed via
SlackSlashCommandSignatureValidationAdvice before reaching this controller.

Handles incoming Slack Events API requests including URL verification and workspace lifecycle events.
The request body is JSON and contains event details. Signature validation is performed via
SlackEventsSignatureValidationAdvice before reaching this controller.

get.description: Requires global administrator permission.

parameters.name: integrationType
parameters.description: Integration type

post.description: Requires global administrator permission.

post.summary: Suggest a fix for the given issueId
post.description: Requires Code Viewer permission.

Only third party license keys are accepted.
  Requires 'Administer System' permission.

This method is for users who activated the license using offline method. It should be used to
  fully deactivate the license (i.e. in cases of migrating the installation to a new server).

get.summary: Retrieve a valid .req file for offline activation
get.description:
Retrieves a .req file for offline activation of a license.
  Requires 'Administer System' permission.

parameters.name: License-Key
parameters.description: The unique license key associated with the license, in the format 'ABCD-EFGH-IJKL-MNOP'. Required in the 'License-Key' HTTP header for offline activation.

post.description:
The content of the request body should be the text of the license file, along with a valid license key.
  Requires 'Administer System' permission.

Only license keys received from Sonar are accepted.
  Requires 'Administer System' permission.

post.summary: Create a SonarQube project with the information from the provided DevOps platform project.

Create a SonarQube project with the information from the provided DevOps platform project.
Autoconfigure Pull-Request decoration mechanism.
Requires the 'Create Projects' permission and setting a Personal Access Token with api/alm_integrations/set_pat for a user who will be using this endpoint

Fetch the Atlassian Authentication details if they exist.
Specifically, only the client ID is returned for security purposes.

get.description:
Fetch a single user.
The following fields are only returned when user has Administer System permission or for logged-in in user :
    'email'
    'externalIdentity'
    'externalProvider'
    'groups'
    'lastConnectionDate'
    'sonarLintLastConnectionDate'
    'tokensCount'
  Field 'sonarqubeLastConnectionDate' is only updated every hour, so it may not be accurate, for instance when a user authenticates many times in less than one hour.

parameters.description: The id of the user to fetch.

parameters.name: anonymize
parameters.description: Anonymize user in addition to deactivating it.

get.summary: Get the status of SCA feature opt-in (should only be used for the configuration UX in frontend)

get.summary: Returns a list of all the available Jira work types for a specific Jira project
get.description:
Returns a list of all the available Jira work types for a specific Jira project.
Also checks which work types are selected for a given sonar project. Conditionally, also includes field metadata.

patch.summary: Saves the selected Jira work types for a project
patch.description: Receives a Jira project key and a list of work type and stores the work types.

get.description:
Fetch the current instance-level sandbox settings.
Returns configuration including enabled status, default value, allowOverride setting, and software qualities or rule types based on current mode.
Requires 'Administer System' permission.

patch.description:
Update the instance-level sandbox settings.
Cannot enable sandbox without providing software qualities or rule types unless they already exist.
When disabling allowOverride, all project-level software quality overrides are deleted.
Requires 'Administer System' permission.

get.description:
Fetch the sandbox settings for a specific project.
Returns effective configuration including enabled status, software qualities overrides, and whether settings are inherited from instance or overridden at project level.
Requires 'Administer Project' permission.

patch.description:
Update the sandbox settings for a specific project.
The enabled setting can be changed independently of software quality overrides.
When allowOverride is disabled at instance level, software quality changes are not allowed but enabled changes are still permitted.
Setting overridden=false removes project-level software quality overrides to inherit from instance settings.
Requires 'Administer Project' permission and instance sandbox must be enabled.

delete.summary: Delete an integration configuration and all its related data.
delete.description:
Requires global administrator permission.
This will permanently delete the integration configuration, all associated workspaces, user bindings, and subscriptions.

parameters.name: id

patch.description: Requires global administrator permission.

get.summary: Gets the status of ongoing database migrations, if any
get.description: Return the detailed status of ongoing database migrations including starting date. If no migration is ongoing or needed it is still possible to call this endpoint and receive appropriate information.

get.summary: Provide liveness of SonarQube, meant to be used as a liveness probe on Kubernetes
get.description:
Require 'Administer System' permission or authentication with passcode.

  When SonarQube is fully started, liveness check for database connectivity, Compute Engine status, and, except for DataCenter Edition, if ElasticSearch is Green or Yellow.

  When SonarQube is on Safe Mode (for example when a database migration is running), liveness check only for database connectivity

parameters.name: X-Sonar-Passcode
parameters.description: Passcode can be provided, see SonarQube documentation

default.description: This SonarQube node is not alive and should be rescheduled

get.description:
Run a self test that the dependency analysis (SCA) feature is enabled and
able to reach the cloud services it relies on.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

get.summary: Run a self test that Spring is configured as expected
get.description:
Run a self test that Spring is set up and working as we expect.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

get.summary: Get a software bill of materials (SBOM) report
get.description:
Return a report based on the dependencies in this component's branch, using
the type parameter and Accept header to select the report to generate.

Right now, the available reports have specialized MIME types that
go along with those formats:

* CycloneDX: https://cyclonedx.org/specification/overview/
  * JSON & XML
* SPDX 2.3: https://spdx.github.io/spdx-spec/v2.3/
  * JSON & XML
* SPDX 3.0: https://spdx.github.io/spdx-spec/v3.0.1/
  * JSON

parameters.name: component
parameters.description: Key of the component (project, application, portfolio) to build report for

schema.description: Key of the component (project, application, portfolio) to build report for

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Key of the branch to build report for

schema.description: Key of the branch to build report for

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Type of report to generate.
The `Accept` header sent by the client determines the format of the report.
Currently supported: cyclonedx (application/vnd.cyclonedx+json), cyclonedx (application/vnd.cyclonedx+xml),
spdx_23 (application/spdx+json), spdx_23 (application/spdx+xml),
spdx_30 (application/spdx+json)

schema.description:
Type of report to generate.
The `Accept` header sent by the client determines the format of the report.
Currently supported: cyclonedx (application/vnd.cyclonedx+json), cyclonedx (application/vnd.cyclonedx+xml),
spdx_23 (application/spdx+json), spdx_23 (application/spdx+xml),
spdx_30 (application/spdx+json)

200.description: The desired report in the desired output format

get.summary: Get a report for all the current SCA dependency risks for a given component and branch
get.description: Returns list of all risks for a given component and branch. CSV format is available by setting `Accept: text/csv` in your request headers.

parameters.name: component
parameters.description: Key of the component (project, application, portfolio) to build report for

schema.description: Key of the component (project, application, portfolio) to build report for

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Key of the branch to build report for

schema.description: Key of the branch to build report for

parameters.name: riskType
parameters.description: Type of risk to filter the report by. If not provided, all risks types are included.

schema.description: Type of risk to filter the report by. If not provided, all risks types are included.

200.description: The report in the desired output format

get.description:
Search for package releases that appear in the analyzed project,
application, or portfolio, as determined by software composition analysis.

This endpoint returns one result for each release,
rather than one result for each time a release is pulled in.
Each result may appear in multiple files or scopes that
all use the same version of the affected package.

The search results do not include full details on the dependencies
that pull in each release, only a summary. To get the full dependency
details, use the /releases/{key} endpoint for a single release.

In the terminology of this endpoint, a "release" is a version of
a package like "lodash 1.2.3", and a "dependency" is a specific file
and scope that pulls in the release such as "subproject/pom.xml test".
Each returned release may have multiple dependencies.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: Key of the component (project, application, or portfolio) to fetch all dependencies from

schema.description: Key of the component (project, application, or portfolio) to fetch all dependencies from

parameters.name: branchKey
parameters.description: Key of the branch to fetch all dependencies from. If not provided, the default branch will be used unless a pull request key is provided.

schema.description: Key of the branch to fetch all dependencies from. If not provided, the default branch will be used unless a pull request key is provided.

parameters.name: pullRequestKey
parameters.description: Key of the pull request to fetch all dependencies from.

schema.description: Key of the pull request to fetch all dependencies from.

parameters.name: direct
parameters.description: Filter on the direct attribute. TRUE stands for direct dependencies, FALSE for transitive dependencies.

schema.description: Filter on the direct attribute. TRUE stands for direct dependencies, FALSE for transitive dependencies.

parameters.name: newlyIntroduced
parameters.description: Filter on the newlyIntroduced attribute. TRUE stands for only releases introduced vs. the target branch, FALSE for releases shared with target.

schema.description: Filter on the newlyIntroduced attribute. TRUE stands for only releases introduced vs. the target branch, FALSE for releases shared with target.

parameters.name: productionScope
parameters.description: Filter on the productionScope attribute. TRUE stands for only production dependencies, FALSE for only not in production. If a release is both, it matches both.

schema.description: Filter on the productionScope attribute. TRUE stands for only production dependencies, FALSE for only not in production. If a release is both, it matches both.
Filter on the package manager

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter on the package name. This parameter performs a partial match (contains and case insensitive) on the package name.

schema.description: Filter on the package name. This parameter performs a partial match (contains and case insensitive) on the package name.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per page. A value of 0 will only return the pagination information.

schema.description: Number of results per page. A value of 0 will only return the pagination information.

parameters.name: pageIndex
parameters.description: 1-based page index

schema.description: 1-based page index

get.description:
Fetch a single release by its key.

This single-release endpoint lists full details for all dependencies
that mention the release.

In the terminology of this endpoint, a "release" is a version of
a package like "lodash 1.2.3", and a "dependency" is a specific file
and scope that pulls in the release such as "subproject/pom.xml test".
Each returned release may have multiple dependencies.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the release to fetch.

get.description:
List the projects that can be assigned to the license profile. Assigning the
  project to a license profile will cause that license profile to be used when
  analyzing the project for license issues.

parameters.name: licenseProfileUuid
parameters.description: The key of the license profile whose assignable projects should be retrieved.

schema.description: The key of the license profile whose assignable projects should be retrieved.

parameters.name: assignedToLicenseProfile
parameters.description:
Providing this parameter filters by whether projects are assigned to the license profile or not.
  Omitting this parameter includes all projects which can be assigned to the license profile,
  regardless of whether they are already assigned to the license profile.

schema.description:
Providing this parameter filters by whether projects are assigned to the license profile or not.
  Omitting this parameter includes all projects which can be assigned to the license profile,
  regardless of whether they are already assigned to the license profile.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Providing this parameter performs a partial match (contains and case insensitive) on the project name.

schema.description: Providing this parameter performs a partial match (contains and case insensitive) on the project name.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per page. A value of 0 will only return the pagination information.

schema.description: Number of results per page. A value of 0 will only return the pagination information.

parameters.name: pageIndex
parameters.description: 1-based page index

schema.description: 1-based page index

get.description:
Search for software composition analysis issues (dependency risks)
of a project, paired with releases that appear in the analyzed
project, application, or portfolio.

This endpoint returns one result for each (issue,release) pair,
rather than one result for each distinct issue. So for example
if a library uses two different versions of a package and
both versions are affected by the same vulnerability, you will
get two results not one.

However each result may appear in multiple files or scopes that
all use the same version of the affected package.

In the terminology of this endpoint, a "release" is a version of
a package like "lodash 1.2.3", an "issue" is a problem such as
"CVE-1234", and a "dependency" is a specific file and scope that
pulls in the release such as "subproject/pom.xml test".

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

parameters.name: projectKey
parameters.description: Key of the component (project, application, portfolio) to fetch all dependency risks from.

schema.description: Key of the component (project, application, portfolio) to fetch all dependency risks from.

parameters.name: branchKey
parameters.description: Key of the branch to fetch all dependency risks from. If not provided, the default branch will be used unless a pull request key is provided.

schema.description: Key of the branch to fetch all dependency risks from. If not provided, the default branch will be used unless a pull request key is provided.

parameters.name: pullRequestKey
parameters.description: Key of the pull request to fetch all dependency risks from.

schema.description: Key of the pull request to fetch all dependency risks from.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort order

schema.description: Sort order

Filter on the issue type
Filter on the quality domain
Filter on the severity
Filter on the status

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: Filter on the package name. This parameter performs a partial match (contains and case insensitive) on the package name.

schema.description: Filter on the package name. This parameter performs a partial match (contains and case insensitive) on the package name.

parameters.name: vulnerabilityId
parameters.description: Filter on the vulnerability ID. This parameter performs a partial match (contains and case insensitive) on the vulnerability ID.

schema.description: Filter on the vulnerability ID. This parameter performs a partial match (contains and case insensitive) on the vulnerability ID.

parameters.name: newlyIntroduced
parameters.description: Filter on the isNew attribute. TRUE stands for only releases introduced vs. the target branch, FALSE for releases shared with target.

schema.description: Filter on the isNew attribute. TRUE stands for only releases introduced vs. the target branch, FALSE for releases shared with target.

parameters.name: direct
parameters.description: Filter on the direct attribute. TRUE stands for only direct dependencies, FALSE for only transitive. If a release is both, it matches both.

schema.description: Filter on the direct attribute. TRUE stands for only direct dependencies, FALSE for only transitive. If a release is both, it matches both.

parameters.name: productionScope
parameters.description: Filter on the productionScope attribute. TRUE stands for only production dependencies, FALSE for only not in production. If a release is both, it matches both.

schema.description: Filter on the productionScope attribute. TRUE stands for only production dependencies, FALSE for only not in production. If a release is both, it matches both.
Filter on assignee logins.
Filter on project keys.

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: Filter on whether the issue is assigned or not.

schema.description: Filter on whether the issue is assigned or not.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per page. A value of 0 will only return the pagination information.

schema.description: Number of results per page. A value of 0 will only return the pagination information.

parameters.name: pageIndex
parameters.description: 1-based page index

schema.description: 1-based page index

get.description:
Fetch a single (issue,release) pair (dependency risk), using the key from the search endpoint.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the issue,release pair to fetch.

get.description:
Gets the available SCA CLI downloads. The response includes metadata about each option
such as the filename and operating system.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

parameters.description: Filter by CPU architecture

schema.description: Filter by CPU architecture

get.summary: Get metadata for a specific CLI download
get.description:
Gets the metadata for a specific SCA CLI download. The response includes the
filename, SHA-256 checksum, operating system, and CPU architecture.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the SCA CLI download

get.summary: Fetch analysis status for one branch
get.description:
Fetch analysis status information for a branch. If the branch has
never been analyzed, will return a status of 404.

This is an internal API and is subject to change without notice.

If the user is not authenticated, returns an empty list.

delete.summary: Remove the project's assignment to the license profile.
delete.description:
Remove the project's assignment to the license profile. If there is a default license profile,
   it will be used to analyze license issues for this project.
Remove a user from a group

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the group membership to delete.

local.description: Specify if the user should be authenticated from SonarQube server or from an external authentication system. Password should not be set when local is set to false.

password.description: User password. Only mandatory when creating local user, otherwise it should not be set

port.description: Port of your SMTP server (usually 25, 587 or 465)

securityProtocol.description: Security protocol used to connect to your SMTP server (SSLTLS is recommended)

subjectPrefix.description: Prefix added to email so they can be easily recognized (usually "[SonarQube]")

authMethod.description: Authentication method used to connect to the SMTP server. OAuth is only supported for Microsoft Exchange

username.description: For Basic and OAuth authentication: username used to authenticate to the SMTP server

basicPassword.description: For basic authentication: password used to authenticate to the SMTP server

oauthAuthenticationHost.description: For OAuth authentication: host of the Identity Provider issuing access tokens

oauthClientId.description: For OAuth authentication: Client ID provided by Microsoft Exchange when registering the application

oauthClientSecret.description: For OAuth authentication: Client secret provided by Microsoft Exchange when registering the application

port.description: Port of your SMTP server (usually 25, 587 or 465)

securityProtocol.description: Security protocol used to connect to your SMTP server (SSLTLS is recommended)

subjectPrefix.description: Prefix added to email so they can be easily recognized (usually "[SonarQube]")

authMethod.description: Authentication method used to connect to the SMTP server. OAuth is only supported for Microsoft Exchange

username.description: For Basic and OAuth authentication: username used to authenticate to the SMTP server

isBasicPasswordSet.description: For Basic authentication: has the password field been set?

oauthAuthenticationHost.description: For OAuth authentication: host of the Identity Provider issuing access tokens

isOauthClientIdSet.description: For OAuth authentication: has the Client ID field been set?

isOauthClientSecretSet.description: For OAuth authentication: has the Client secret field been set?

name.description: The name of the license policy

default.description: Whether this license policy is the default or not

recommendation.description: The maintainer's overall recommendation, if available

version.description: The version being presented as an option

prerelease.description: Is this version a pre-release version

descriptionCode.description: How the frontend should label this version

createdBy.description: User who created or reauthorized the jira connection

binding.description: The successfully created binding (present if binding was created)

resources.description: Array of available resources to bind the instance to

permissions.description: Set of SonarQube permissions to apply

url.description: Url of Gitlab instance for authentication (for instance https://gitlab.com)
Url of Gitlab instance for authentication (for instance https://gitlab.com/api/v4)

allowedGroups.description: Root Gitlab groups allowed to authenticate and provisioned

isProvisioningTokenSet.description: Whether or not the provisioningToken is defined

errorMessage.description: In case the GitLab configuration is incorrect, error message

clientId.description: Client ID provided by GitHub when registering the application.

clientSecret.description: Client password provided by GitHub when registering the application.

applicationId.description: The App ID is found on your GitHub App's page on GitHub at Settings > Developer Settings > GitHub Apps.

privateKey.description:
Your GitHub App's private key. You can generate a .pem file from your GitHub App's page under Private keys.
Copy and paste the whole contents of the file here.

synchronizeGroups.description:
Synchronize GitHub team with SonarQube group memberships when users log in to SonarQube.
For each GitHub team they belong to, users will be associated to a group of the same name if it exists in SonarQube.

apiUrl.description: The API url for a GitHub instance. https://api.github.com/ for Github.com, https://github.company.com/api/v3/ when using Github Enterprise

webUrl.description: The WEB url for a GitHub instance. https://github.com/ for Github.com, https://github.company.com/ when using GitHub Enterprise.

projectVisibility.description:
Change project visibility based on GitHub repository visibility.
If disabled, every provisioned project will be private in SonarQube and visible only to users with explicit GitHub permissions for the corresponding repository.
Changes take effect at the next synchronization.

userConsentRequiredAfterUpgrade.description: Admin consent to synchronize permissions from GitHub

apiUrl.description: Url of GitHub instance for API connectivity (for instance https://api.github.com)

webUrl.description: Url of GitHub instance for authentication (for instance https://github.com)

allowedOrganizations.description: GitHub organizations allowed to authenticate and provisioned

errorMessage.description: In case the GitHub configuration is incorrect, error message

projectKey.description: Key of the project to create

projectName.description: Name of the project to create

devOpsPlatformSettingId.description: Identifier of DevOps platform configuration to use. Use /dop-translation/dop-settings to retrieve the settings and their ID

repositoryIdentifier.description:
Identifier of the DevOps platform repository to import:
- repository slug for GitHub and Bitbucket (Cloud and Server)
- repository id for GitLab
- repository name for Azure DevOps

projectIdentifier.description:
Identifier of the DevOps platform project in which the repository is located.
This is only needed for Azure and BitBucket Server platforms

newCodeDefinitionType.description:
Project New Code Definition Type
  New code definitions of the following types are allowed:
    - PREVIOUS_VERSION
    - NUMBER_OF_DAYS
    - REFERENCE_BRANCH - will default to the main branch.

newCodeDefinitionValue.description:
Project New Code Definition Value
  For each new code definition type, a different value is expected:
  - no value, when the new code definition type is PREVIOUS_VERSION and REFERENCE_BRANCH
  - a number between 1 and 90, when the new code definition type is NUMBER_OF_DAYS

monorepo.description: True if project is part of a mono repo.

projectId.description: The identifier of the created project

bindingId.description: The identifier of the binding between the created project and the DevOps platform project

key.description: Key of the custom rule to create, must include the repository

templateKey.description: Key of the rule template to be used to create the custom rule

parameters.description: Custom rule parameters

name.description: Name for the new group. Must be unique. The value 'anyone' is reserved and cannot be used.

userId.description: ID of the user to add to group.

groupId.description: ID of the group where a member needs to be added.

name.description: User first name and last name

externalLogin.description: New external login, usually the login used in the authentication system.

externalId.description: New external id in the authentication system.

port.description: Port of your SMTP server (usually 25, 587 or 465)

securityProtocol.description: Security protocol used to connect to your SMTP server (SSLTLS is recommended)

subjectPrefix.description: Prefix added to email so they can be easily recognized (usually "[SonarQube]")

authMethod.description: Authentication method used to connect to the SMTP server. OAuth is only supported for Microsoft Exchange

username.description: For Basic and OAuth authentication: username used to authenticate to the SMTP server

basicPassword.description: For basic authentication: password used to authenticate to the SMTP server

oauthAuthenticationHost.description: For OAuth authentication: host of the Identity Provider issuing access tokens

oauthClientId.description: For OAuth authentication: Client ID provided by Microsoft Exchange when registering the application

oauthClientSecret.description: For OAuth authentication: Client password provided by Microsoft Exchange when registering the application

name.description: The name of the license policy

default.description: Whether this license policy is the default or not

policy.description: The new status of this license.
The policy status of this license.
The new status of this category.
The policy status of this category.

licenseProfileUuid.description: The id of the license profile that should be used when analyzing the project for license issues.

projectKey.description: The key of the project that should be assigned to the license profile.

enablement.description: Whether SCA is enabled or not

selectedWorkTypes.description: An array with the selected work type ids

jiraCloudId.description: Jira cloud ID to bind with the organization

enabled.description: Whether sandbox is enabled for this project

overridden.description: Whether project settings override instance settings

permissions.description: Set of SonarQube permissions to apply

url.description: Url of Gitlab instance for authentication (for instance https://gitlab.com/api/v4)

apiUrl.description: Url of GitHub instance for API connectivity (for instance https://api.github.com)

webUrl.description: Url of GitHub instance for authentication (for instance https://github.com)

userConsentRequiredAfterUpgrade.description: Admin consent to synchronize permissions from GitHub

hasDefaultValue.description: Whether the field has a default value

subtask.description: true, if the Jira work type is a subtask

selected.description: true, if the Jira work type is selected

fields.description: Array of field metadata for the specified work type. (Optional)

type.description: Supported DevOps Platform are: github, gitlab, azure, bitbucketcloud, bitbucket_server
